item.title: Three Ways To Spice Up Your Python Code
item.description: Spice Up Your Life Python üêç I’m currently working on a side project that I’ve written in Python. Now I’ve have a lot of experience with Python before, I used it primarily to write a load of scripts for automating processes for when Bash didn’t quite cut it. Don’t get me wrong Bash is great, but like for every other language out there, each has its purpose in the world.

item.title: Extending Gotests for Strict Error Tests
item.description: Strict Error Tests in Java I love confirming the stability of my code through writing tests and practicing Test-driven development (TDD). For Java, JUnit was my preferred testing framework of choice. When writing tests to confirm an exception had been thrown, I used the optional parameter expected for the annotation @Test, however I quickly found that this solution would not work for methods where I raised the same exception class multiple times for different error messages, and testing on those messages.

item.title: Blog Bootstrap
item.description: Howdy! üëã This site will be an area for me to braindump everything and anything that comes across my mind - although I’ll try my best to keep it tech-focused! The blog platform itself is pretty basic. It is built using Hugo, hosted using GitHub Pages, while served over a custom domain via CloudFlare. While this isn’t exactly anything to brag about, it is only meant to be a quick and easy platform to spin up and get hosted so that I can focus on what really matters… the content!
